question:
You are going to another country to study. You would like to do a part-time job while your are studying, so you want to ask a friend who lives there for some help.
Write a letter to this fiend. In your letter:
-give details of your study plans
-explain why you want to get a part-time job
-suggest how your friend could help you find a job
text: How are you? I hope this letter finds you well. As you already know, I am planning to attend my Master's degree at Queen's College in London. It is two years course along with six months project from any Industry. I am excited that my course starts in April this year.

Having said that, I am also anxious about my stay expenses during the course, as things are relatively expensive in London.  As you know about the economic situation and I'm just wondering if you could help me find a part-time job there and get some references for the job, so I can cover my personal expenses.

My course will take approximately two years to complete. The classes will be normally held on weekdays only and I will be free on weekends. Hence, It would be a great help if you could introduce me to any part-time job available around the University area and look for the classified section in the local newspaper.
I would really appreciate your help and support. Thank you in advance.
